notes.text:
The TCP/IP stack and related services (FTP, TFTP) of the networking component (Nucleus NET) in Nucleus Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) contain several vulnerabilities, also known as "NUCLEUS:13" and as documented below.

Siemens has released updates for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends countermeasures for products where updates are not available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.

Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: Siemens Security Advisories are subject to the terms and conditions contained in Siemens' underlying license terms or other applicable agreements previously agreed to with Siemens (hereinafter "License Terms"). To the extent applicable to information, software or documentation made available in or through a Siemens Security Advisory, the Terms of Use of Siemens' Global Website (https://www.siemens.com/terms_of_use, hereinafter "Terms of Use"), in particular Sections 8-10 of the Terms of Use, shall apply additionally. In case of conflicts, the License Terms shall prevail over the Terms of Use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this product or otherwise. Further dissemination of this product is governed by the Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) marking in the header. For more information about TLP, see https://us-cert.cisa.gov/tlp/.
notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: This CISA CSAF advisory was converted from Siemens ProductCERT's CSAF advisory.
notes.title: Advisory Conversion Disclaimer

notes.text: Multiple
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: Germany
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the exploitation risk of this vulnerability.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, and ensure they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most recent version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as its connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets. Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

revision_history.summary: Moved product CAPITAL VSTAR to a separate advisory (SSA-620288)

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text: ICMP echo packets with fake IP options allow sending ICMP echo reply messages to arbitrary hosts on the network. (FSMD-2021-0004)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Update to V4.1.1 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input

notes.text: The total length of an UDP payload (set in the IP header) is unchecked. This may lead to various side effects, including Information Leak and Denial-of-Service conditions, depending on a user-defined applications that runs on top of the UDP protocol. (FSMD-2021-0006)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input

notes.text: The total length of an ICMP payload (set in the IP header) is unchecked. This may lead to various side effects, including Information Leak and Denial-of-Service conditions, depending on the network buffer organization in memory. (FSMD-2021-0007)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Update to V4.1.1 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

notes.text: When processing a DHCP OFFER message, the DHCP client application does not validate the length of the Vendor option(s), leading to Denial-of-Service conditions. (FSMD-2021-0008)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: The DHCP client application does not validate the length of the Domain Name Server IP option(s) (0x06) when processing DHCP ACK packets. This may lead to Denial-of-Service conditions. (FSMD-2021-0011)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: When processing a DHCP ACK message, the DHCP client application does not validate the length of the Vendor option(s), leading to Denial-of-Service conditions. (FSMD-2021-0013)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice

notes.text: The DHCP client application assumes that the data supplied with the “Hostname” DHCP option is NULL terminated. In cases when global hostname variable is not defined, this may lead to Out-of-bound reads, writes, and Denial-of-service conditions. (FSMD-2021-0014)
notes.title: Summary

Currently no remediation is planned

Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

cwe.name: Buffer Access with Incorrect Length Value

notes.text: TFTP server application allows for reading the contents of the TFTP memory buffer via sending malformed TFTP commands. (FSMD-2021-0009)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned
Update to V2017.02.4 or later version
Update to V4.1.1 or later version
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information

notes.text: FTP server does not properly validate the length of the “USER” command, leading to stack-based buffer overflows. This may result in Denial-of-Service conditions and Remote Code Execution. (FSMD-2021-0010)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Currently no remediation is planned

notes.text: The total length of an TCP payload (set in the IP header) is unchecked. This may lead to various side effects, including Information Leak and Denial-of-Service conditions, depending on the network buffer organization in memory. (FSMD-2021-0017)
